title: Moses Mensah
text:
Moses Mensah (; born 10 August 1978 in <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>) is a former <a href="Ghana">Ghanaian</a>-born <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a> professional <a href="association%20football">football</a>er who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">left back</a>.
Club career.
Moses was born in <a href="Ghana">Ghana</a>. In 2003, he went to <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a> to join <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Third%20Division%20League">Hong Kong Third Division League</a> club <a href="Kowloon%20City%20DRSA">Kowloon City</a>.
In 2004, Moses signed for <a href="Hong%20Kong%20First%20Division%20League">Hong Kong First Division League</a> club <a href="Citizen%20AA">Citizen</a>.
On 28 January 2011, Moses scored his first goal for <a href="Citizen%20AA">Citizen</a> against <a href="HKFC%20Soccer%20Section">HKFC</a>, which the match wins 3–1.
In 2012, after Moses had lived in <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a> for over 7 years, he became a <a href="Hong%20Kong">Hong Kong</a> local player.
In 2013, Moses became the first foreign player who played for <a href="Citizen%20AA">Citizen</a> for over 9 years.
In 2013, Moses signed for <a href="Hong%20Kong%20First%20Division%20League">Hong Kong First Division League</a> club <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Rangers%20FC">Rangers</a>.
On 15 September 2013, Moses scored his first goal for <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Rangers%20FC">Rangers</a> against <a href="Metro%20Gallery%20FC">Yokohama FC Hong Kong</a>, which the match won 3–2.
In November 2013, Moses got the <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Special%20Administrative%20Region%20passport">HKSAR passport</a>.
In 2014, Moses signed for <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Premier%20League">Hong Kong Premier League</a> club <a href="YFCMD">YFCMD</a>.
On 20 July 2015, Moses signed for <a href="Hong%20Kong%20Premier%20League">Hong Kong Premier League</a> club <a href="South%20China%20AA">South China</a>.
